summary: This bill, the Law Enforcement Support and Counter Transnational Repression Act, amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to mandate a public service announcement campaign. This campaign will educate the public and international allies about transnational repression and terrorism threats, including how to report suspicious activity to the FBI. The bill also requires research and development into technologies to support law enforcement in countering these threats. It defines terms like "transnational repression," "agent of a foreign government," and "United States person."
